options.name: --sample-name
options.description: Override the basename of the output fastq file. Default is the basename of the first input file without extension and read 1 identifier.

options.name: --skip-input-checks
options.description: Skip all check on the filename of input fastq files.

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --design
options.description: The design to load from the configuration file

options.name: --trim-front
options.description: Trim N bases from the front of the reads

options.name: --trim-tail
options.description: Trim N bases from the tail of the reads

options.name: --max-length
options.description:
The maximum length (bases) of a read (longer reads will be trimmed off).
If you set this argument it will overrule the value from the chosen design

options.name: --min-length
options.description:
The minimum length (bases) of a read (shorter reads will be discarded).
If you set this argument it will overrule the value from the chosen design

options.name: --max-n-bases
options.description: The maximum number of Ns allowed in a read (default of 0 means any reads with N in it will be filtered out)

options.name: --avg-qual
options.description: Minimum avg. quality a read must have (0 will disable the filter)

options.name: --dedup
options.description: Remove duplicated reads (exact same sequence)

options.name: --remove-polyg
options.description: Remove PolyG sequences (length of 10 or more)

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --design
options.description: The design to load from the configuration file

options.name: --mismatches
options.description: The number of mismatches allowed (in percentage)

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --design
options.description: The design to load from the configuration file

options.name: --mismatches
options.description: The number of mismatches allowed (in percentage)

options.name: --min-length
options.description:
The minimum length of the barcode that must overlap when matching.
If you set this argument it will overrule the value from the chosen design

options.name: --panel
options.description: A key of a panel file in the config, or a csv file with the antibody panel conjugations

options.name: --anchored
options.description:
Enforce the barcodes to be anchored (at the end of the read).
(default: use value determined by --design).

options.name: --rev-complement
options.description:
Use the reverse complement of the barcodes sequences.
(default: use value determined by --design).

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --design
options.description: The design to load from the configuration file

options.name: --markers-ignore
options.description: A list of comma separated antibodies to ignore (discard)

options.name: --algorithm
options.description: The algorithm to use for collapsing (adjacency will perform error correction using the number of mismatches given)

options.name: --max-neighbours
options.description: The maximum number of neighbors to use when searching for similar sequences. This number depends on the sequence depth and the ratio of erronous molecules expected. A high value can make the algorithm slower. This is only used when algorithm is set to 'adjacency'

options.name: --mismatches
options.description: The number of mismatches allowed when collapsing. This is only used when the algorithm is set to 'adjacency'.

options.name: --min-count
options.description: Discard molecules with with a count (reads) lower than this (set to 1 to disable)

options.name: --panel
options.description: A key of a panel file in the config, or a csv file with the antibody panel conjugations

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --design
options.description: The design to load from the configuration file

options.name: --multiplet-recovery
options.description: Activate the multiplet recovery using leiden community detection

options.name: --max-refinement-recursion-depth
options.description: Number of iterations for the leiden algorithm, high values will decrease the variance of the results but increase the runtime

options.name: --min-count
options.description: Discard edges (pixels) with with a count (reads) below this (use 1 to disable)

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --panel
options.description: A key of a panel file in the config, or a csv file with the antibody panel conjugations

options.name: --min-size
options.description: The minimum size (edges) a component must have (default is disabled)

options.name: --max-size
options.description: The maximum size (edges) a component must have (default is disabled)

options.name: --dynamic-filter
options.description:
Enable the estimation of dynamic size filters using a log-rank approach
both: estimate both min and max size    min: estimate min size (--min-size)     max: estimate max size (--max-size)

options.name: --aggregate-calling
options.description: Enable aggregate calling, information on potential aggregates will be added to the output data

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)

options.name: --compute-polarization
options.description: Compute polarization scores matrix (components by markers)

options.name: --compute-colocalization
options.description: Compute colocalization scores (marker by marker) for each component

options.name: --use-full-bipartite
options.description: Use the bipartite graph instead of the one-node projection (UPIA) when computing polarization, coabundance and colocalization scores

options.name: --polarization-normalization
options.description:
Which approach to use to normalize the antibody counts: 
raw will use the raw counts
clr will use the CLR transformed counts

options.name: --polarization-n-permutations
options.description: Set the number of permutations use to compute the empirical z-score and p-value for the polarization score. If not set, only the analytical z-score estimation will be performed

options.name: --colocalization-transformation
options.description: Select the type of transformation to use on the node by antibody counts matrix when computing colocalization

options.name: --colocalization-neighbourhood-size
options.description: Select the size of the neighborhood to use when computing colocalization metrics on each component

options.name: --colocalization-n-permutations
options.description: Set the number of permutations use to compute the empirical p-value for the colocalization score

options.name: --colocalization-min-region-count
options.description: The minimum number of counts in a region for it to be considered valid for computing colocalization

options.name: --output
options.description: The path where the results will be placed (it is created if it does not exist)
